description: Learned borrowing from New Latin acarus, from Ancient Greek ἄκαρι (ákari, “cheese mite, tick”).

entries.meaning: (zoology, acarology) Any member of the subclass Acari (aka Acarina): thus, a mite or a tick; specifically, any mite of the genus Acarus.
examples: The number of Acari found in raw sugar is sometimes exceedingly great, and in no instance is the article quite free from either the insects or their ova (eggs).
